description.narrative: Rural Development Programme (RDP) in partnership with Oxfam Novib has successfully implemented the 12 months project in the three worst affected union councils of District Nowshera. The project has been a success in many ways. The communities were mobilized, sensitized and organized at village level. They were trained through the Community Based Disaster Risk Management (CBDRM) process. They were trained in search and rescue, first aid, establishment of early warning system and more effectively their engagement with the District Disaster management authority to participate in the Disaster Risk Management (DRM) initiatives. The project enabled the interaction between District Government, communities and other stakeholders involved in Disaster Risk Management (DRM). It is a success for the District Nowshera, that for the first time funds were allocated for Disaster Risk Management (DRM) interventions rather thanemergency and relief operations in the aftermath. Overall this project is based on the premise of putting the at risk communities at the heart of the Community Based Disaster Risk Management (CBDRM) process and giving them the lead to build their capacities, reduce vulnerabilities and mobilize the resources through internal and external relationships. This is an in-built feature of the implementation strategy which will enable the communities to strengthen their institutions for effective functions, interact with the decision makers in a dignified and non-confrontational mode and raising the awareness at mass level to adopt a culture of safety and security. The project will also bring about the change in the policy implementation at district level through systematic process of citizen engagements in the governance. The already established systems are not functional this increases the vulnerabilities of the communities. The project will also facilitate to operationalize the functions through extensive mobilization, dialogues and allocation of resources.

participating-org.narrative: Rural Development Project (RDP) is a non-profit and non-governmental organisation working for the empowerment of poor and vulnerable communities in Pakistan. Established in 1992 by a set of highly motivated, socially committed and like-minded individualsthe organisation was registered under societies Act of 1860 in December 1993. RDP started its activities in 1992 on mutual help basis by mobilizing and organizing the masses for disaster management, poverty alleviation, gender-Discrimination and protection of human rights.Currently RDP is a national level humanitarian organization working in Khyber Pukhtoonkhawa and Sindh provinces seven districts named Haripur, Mansehra, Charsadda, Nowshera, Mardan, Swabi, Buner and Peshawer. Having a network of established offices in Balakot, Mansehra, Haripur, Mardan and Sanghar, RDP is implementing a long term multi-sectoral program of livelihoods rehabilitation. Being rights based humanitarian organisation, RDP was able to respond the catastrophic earthquake of October 8, 2005, IDPs crisis 2009 and Pakistan floods 2010-2011. In all such responses, RDP was able to support and facilitate the poor and vulnerable families in differentphases of emergency response, early recovery and reconstruction. RDP#s response mechanisms are based on its twenty years experienceof disaster risk reduction and management. In earthquake response RDP was able to connect the emergency relief with early recovery and early recovery with rehabilitation and long term development. Organization replicated its best practices during the IDPs crisis of April 2009 and flash floods of 2010-2011 thus providing the most relevant and appropriate emergency response and recovery services in different districts of Khyber Pukhtoonkhawa and Sindh.
